statements: SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics;
SELECT employee_id, performance_rating FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics;
SELECT performance_rating, goal_setting FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics;
SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics ORDER BY performance_rating DESC;
SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE employee_id = 101;
SELECT employee_id, performance_rating FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE performance_rating > 4;
SELECT employee_id, goal_setting FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE goal_setting LIKE '%improve%';
SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE performance_rating BETWEEN 3 AND 5 ORDER BY performance_rating DESC;
SELECT COUNT(employee_id) AS total_employees, AVG(performance_rating) AS avg_rating FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeMetrics;
SELECT first_name, last_name, metric1, metric2 FROM EmployeeMetrics ORDER BY metric1 DESC;
SELECT employee_id, goal_name, goal_description FROM Goals WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM EmployeeMetrics WHERE metric1 > 50;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeMetrics WHERE metric1 BETWEEN 20 AND 30;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeMetrics WHERE metric1 > 50 ORDER BY last_name DESC, first_name ASC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, metric1, metric2 FROM EmployeeMetrics WHERE employee_id = 3;
SELECT first_name, last_name, goal_name, goal_description FROM EmployeeMetrics JOIN Goals ON EmployeeMetrics.employee_id = Goals.employee_id;
SELECT EmployeeMetrics.employee_id, SUM(metric1) AS total_metric1, AVG(metric2) AS avg_metric2 FROM EmployeeMetrics GROUP BY EmployeeMetrics.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM Goals WHERE goal_description LIKE '%improve%' OR goal_description LIKE '%develop%' ORDER BY goal_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department FROM employees;
SELECT employee_id, hire_date FROM employees;
SELECT * FROM performance_metrics;
SELECT metric_name, metric_value FROM performance_metrics;
SELECT name, department FROM employees
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'Sales'
SELECT name, hire_date FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC
SELECT e.name, g.goal_description FROM employees e JOIN goals g ON e.employee_id = g.employee_id
SELECT p.metric_name, p.metric_value FROM performance_metrics p WHERE p.metric_value > 90
SELECT * FROM Employee
SELECT name, department FROM Employee ORDER BY department ASC
SELECT review_id, review_date, overall_rating FROM PerformanceReview WHERE overall_rating > 3
SELECT goal_id, employee_id, goal, deadline FROM GoalSetting ORDER BY deadline DESC
SELECT department_id, department_name, manager_id FROM Department
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE department='HR' ORDER BY name DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT id, name FROM Employee WHERE department='IT' AND id > 100 ORDER BY id ASC LIMIT 10

SELECT Employee.name, PerformanceReview.review_date, PerformanceReview.overall_rating FROM Employee INNER JOIN PerformanceReview ON Employee.id = PerformanceReview.employee_id WHERE PerformanceReview.overall_rating >= 4 ORDER BY PerformanceReview.review_date DESC LIMIT 3

SELECT Employee.name, GoalSetting.goal, GoalSetting.deadline FROM Employee INNER JOIN GoalSetting ON Employee.id = GoalSetting.employee_id WHERE GoalSetting.deadline > '2022-12-31' ORDER BY Employee.name ASC LIMIT 5

SELECT Department.department_name, COUNT(Employee.id) AS total_employees FROM Employee INNER JOIN Department ON Employee.department = Department.department_name GROUP BY Department.department_name HAVING COUNT(Employee.id) > 5 ORDER BY total_employees DESC
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'Sales';
SELECT employee_name, job_title FROM employees WHERE hire_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM performance_reviews ORDER BY review_date DESC;
SELECT reviewer, rating, comments FROM performance_reviews WHERE rating > 3;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR' ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT employee_name, job_title FROM employees LEFT JOIN goals ON employees.employee_id = goals.employee_id WHERE status = 'In Progress';
SELECT employee_name, review_date, reviewer FROM employees INNER JOIN performance_reviews ON employees.employee_id = performance_reviews.employee_id WHERE rating > 3 ORDER BY review_date ASC;
SELECT employee_name, project_name, start_date FROM employees INNER JOIN projects ON employees.department = 'Engineering' AND employees.employee_id = projects.project_id;
SELECT department_name, department_head FROM departments ORDER BY department_name DESC;
